description: Many open source, volunteer-driven projects begin with a small, tight-knit group of collaborators, but then rapidly expand far faster than anyone expects or plans for. I discuss cases of governance growing pains in Wikipedia, which have many lessons for running open source software projects. I discuss how Wikipedians have dealt with various issues as they have become one of the largest volunteer-based open collaboration projects, including the project’s growing bureaucracy and controversies between volunteers and professional staff.
title: Governing Open Source Projects at Scale: Lessons from Wikipedia's Growing Pains
